author: Reuters Editorial
title: EU demands compensation for U.S. steel tariffs at WTO
text:
GENEVA (Reuters) - The European Union is seeking compensation from the United States for U.S. tariffs on steel and aluminum, despite Washington’s claim that they are not subject to World Trade Organization rules, a WTO filing showed on Monday.
A steel coil is unrolled on the line at the Novolipetsk Steel PAO steel mill in Farrell, Pennsylvania, U.S., March 9, 2018. REUTERS/Aaron Josefczyk In a step already taken by China, the EU said it did not accept the U.S. claim that the tariffs were based on national security, and it regarded them as “safeguard tariffs” under the WTO rules.
Reporting by Tom Miles; Editing by Hugh Lawson
